Class ParticlesSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • ParticlesSystem

  • public class ParticlesSystem
extends java.lang.Object
    A particles' System is a mechanical 2D system which contains free and tied up particles.

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update()
        Update the whole particle's System (each particle position)

      • setParticlePosition

        protected void setParticlePosition(int i,
                       int j,
                       float x,
                       float y)
        Set up in the outGridMatrix the particle position scaled to FluidParticleSimulation.GL_...
        Parameters:
        i - Column's index of the particle
        j - Line's index of the particle
        x - Abscissa of the particle scaled by ParticlesSystem.ENGINE_X
        y - Ordinate of the particle scaled by ParticlesSystem.ENGINE_Y

        Parameters:

        y - Ordinate of the particle scaled by ParticlesSystem.ENGINE_Y

                           int j,
                           float initX,
                           float initY)
        Set up in the initGridMatrix the particle position scaled to FluidParticleSimulation.GL_...
        Parameters:
        i - Column's index of the particle
        j - Line's index of the particle
        initX - Initial abscissa of the particle scaled by ParticlesSystem.ENGINE_X
        initY - Initial ordinate of the particle scaled by ParticlesSystem.ENGINE_Y

      • addParticles

        protected void addParticles(float x,
                float y,
                int nb)
        Add nb free particles in the system at the indicates position
        Parameters:
        x - Abscissa of the position to add particles scaled by ParticlesSystem.ENGINE_X
        y - Ordinate of the position to add particles scaled by ParticlesSystem.ENGINE_Y
        nb - Number of particles to add

      • hasGridParticles

        public boolean hasGridParticles()
        Determine if the system has at least one tied up particle
        Returns:
        true if at least one tied up particle exists, false otherwise

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset the particle system. Free particles will be cleared and tied up particles will be restored to initial position

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Properly destroy the system.

      • getMemory

        public int getMemory()
        Getter : memory
        Returns:
